NewWords.Sentence: e.g. She's an old acquaintance of mine.
e.g. There was a lack of communications between us.

NewWords.WordPhrase: n. a single human being 个人
NewWords.Sentence: e.g. We designed this software in order to meet the needs of individual users.

NewWords.WordPhrase: a. knowing no evil, naive天真无邪的  n. an innocent person
NewWords.Sentence: e.g. Jack is still as innocent as a child and is easily taken in.

NewWords.WordPhrase: a.  serious and concentrated 认真的，紧张的
NewWords.Sentence: e.g. I have never seen an intense student like him.

NewWords.WordPhrase: all things considered, in general 总的看来，大体上，基本上
NewWords.Sentence: e.g. On the whole, your opinion is right.

NewWords.WordPhrase: in addition to 除…之外（还）
NewWords.Sentence: e.g. An extra 700 jobs are being cut on top of the 2,000 that were lost last year.

NewWords.WordPhrase: ad. during or for the night 一整夜，一夜间
NewWords.Sentence: e.g. If you leave your bike here overnight, it's likely to disappear.

NewWords.WordPhrase: n. a plan or an outline of the events in a play or novel 情节
NewWords.Sentence: e.g. The author wove a story from three plots.

NewWords.WordPhrase: vt. throw in different directions 散布
NewWords.Sentence: e.g. The farmers are scattering seeds over the fields.
e.g. He slipped out into the garage.
e.g. There is a tendency to use plastics in place of metals.

NewWords.WordPhrase: as far as one knows personally 据…所知
NewWords.Sentence: e.g. To my knowledge, Jack didn't get the job offer.

NewWords.WordPhrase: n.  传播媒介；交通工具
NewWords.Sentence: e.g. Air is the vehicle of sound.

NewWords.WordPhrase: n.  a particular form or variation of sth. 版本
NewWords.Sentence: e.g. I've read the Chinese version of the novel.

NewWords.WordPhrase: a., ad.  全世界的；在全世界范围内
NewWords.Sentence: e.g. The comet caused a worldwide panic.
